body.p:
H of R. Frankfort
Febry 9th 1865
To the Governor
T. E. Bramlette --

Mr W. H. Shook has been ever since the 5th of November engaged in the service of the state -- About this time, I found him with about one hundred (100) men at Smithland -- I ordered him with his men to move up to Caseyville, which he promptly did -- & on the 12th of Novr 1864, we arrived at that point -- He immediately entered upon his work, that is to say, hunting & driving out the Guerillas from that section of the country & recruiting His work was very laborious -- no man in the state has done more good than he -- he drove out all the bands, that had infested that country for more than a year -- The Union people of the country who had been driven from their homes, have nearly all returned -- In the Raid of Lyon he did more than all the officers & soldiers of the Federal army, tho' a whole & full Brigade was sent after him --

He killed twelve men, Captured about thirty men, thirty good horses & quite a number of small arms -- & saved the towns of his District -- He served notice on all
the drafted men of the District at the request of the Pro. Marll --
He has recruited about four hundred men -- two companies have been mustered & he now has another ready for muster -- One hundred & two (102) men were taken from him, by force, by Johnson &co.
I do think he should be commissioned as Major, dated back to at least the 5th of November 1864 --
I hope you will act upon his case to-day, when the Board meets --

I am Governor
Your true friend
& most obdt sert
P. B. Hawkins
Col &c --

or
s. E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Ky

Frankfort Ky
Feby 9," 1865
Hawkins P. B.
Col &c.
To the Gov --
Asks that W. H. Shook be commissioned Major from 5" Nov. 1864 --
Recd A. G. O. Ky 9 Feby 1865
